member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration
member.summary: Provides access to configuration variables for a repository.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.#ctor
member.summary: Access configuration values without a repository. Generally you want to access configuration via an instance of instead.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Saves any open configuration files.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Delete a configuration variable (key and value).
member.param: The key to delete.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for a key. Keys are in the form 'section.name'.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[core] bare = true
You would call:
bool isBare = repo.Config.Get<bool>("core.bare", false);
member.param: The key
The default value
member.returns: The configuration value, or defaultValue if not set

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String,System.String,``0)
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for a key. Keys are in the form 'section.name'.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[core] bare = true
You would call:
bool isBare = repo.Config.Get<bool>("core", "bare", false);
member.param: The first key part
The second key part
The default value
member.returns: The configuration value, or defaultValue if not set

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String,System.String,System.String,``0)
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for the given key parts.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[difftool "kdiff3"] path = c:/Program Files/KDiff3/kdiff3.exe
You would call:
string where = repo.Config.Get<string>("difftool", "kdiff3", "path", null);
member.param: The first key part
The second key part
The third key part
The default value
member.returns: The configuration value, or defaultValue if not set

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Get``1(System.String[],``0)
member.summary:
Get a configuration value for the given key parts.
For example in order to get the value for this in a .git\config file:
[core] bare = true
You would call:
bool isBare = repo.Config.Get<bool>(new []{ "core", "bare" }, false);
member.param: The key parts
The default value
member.returns: The configuration value, or defaultValue if not set

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.Set``1(System.String,``0,LibGit2Sharp.ConfigurationLevel)
member.summary:
Set a configuration value for a key. Keys are in the form 'section.name'.
For example in order to set the value for this in a .git\config file:
[test] boolsetting = true
You would call:
repo.Config.Set("test.boolsetting", true);

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.HasLocalConfig
member.summary: Determines if there is a local repository level Git configuration file.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.HasGlobalConfig
member.summary: Determines if a Git configuration file specific to the current interactive user has been found.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.Configuration.HasSystemConfig
member.summary: Determines if a system-wide Git configuration file has been found.

member.summary: The global ~/.gitconfig of the current user.

member.summary: The system wide .gitconfig.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Core.Ensure.Success(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Check that the result of a C call was successful
This usually means that the method is expected to return 0. In some rare cases, some methods may return negative values for errors and positive values carrying information. Those positive values should be interpreted as successful calls as well.
member.param: The result to examine.
False to only allow success when comparing against 0, True when positive values are allowed as well.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Core.Ensure.ArgumentConformsTo``1(``0,System.Func{``0,System.Boolean},System.String)
member.summary: Checks an argument by applying provided checker.
member.param: The argument value to check.
The predicate which has to be satisfied
The name of the argument.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_SUCCESS
member.summary: Operation completed successfully.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_ERROR
member.summary: Operation failed, with unspecified reason. This value also serves as the base error code; all other error codes are subtracted from it such that all errors are < 0, in typical POSIX C tradition.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_ENOTOID
member.summary: Input was not a properly formatted Git object id.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_ENOTFOUND
member.summary: Input does not exist in the scope searched.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_ENOMEM
member.summary: Not enough space available.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EOSERR
member.summary: Consult the OS error information.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EOBJTYPE
member.summary: The specified object is of invalid type

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_ENOTAREPO
member.summary: The specified repository is invalid

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EINVALIDTYPE
member.summary: The object type is invalid or doesn't match

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EMISSINGOBJDATA
member.summary: The object cannot be written that because it's missing internal data

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EPACKCORRUPTED
member.summary: The packfile for the ODB is corrupted

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EFLOCKFAIL
member.summary: Failed to adquire or release a file lock

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EZLIB
member.summary: The Z library failed to inflate/deflate an object's data

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EBUSY
member.summary: The queried object is currently busy

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EBAREINDEX
member.summary: The index file is not backed up by an existing repository

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EINVALIDREFNAME
member.summary: The name of the reference is not valid

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EREFCORRUPTED
member.summary: The specified reference has its data corrupted

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_ETOONESTEDSYMREF
member.summary: The specified symbolic reference is too deeply nested

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EPACKEDREFSCORRUPTED
member.summary: The pack-refs file is either corrupted of its format is not currently supported

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EINVALIDPATH
member.summary: The path is invalid

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EREVWALKOVER
member.summary: The revision walker is empty; there are no more commits left to iterate

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EINVALIDREFSTATE
member.summary: The state of the reference is not valid

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_ENOTIMPLEMENTED
member.summary: This feature has not been implemented yet

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EEXISTS
member.summary: A reference with this name already exists

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitErrorCode.GIT_EOVERFLOW
member.summary: The given integer literal is too large to be parsed

member.name: T:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOid

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.Core.GitOid.Id
member.summary: The raw binary 20 byte Id.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Nonexistent
member.summary: The file doesn't exist.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Unaltered
member.summary: The file hasn't been modified.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Added
member.summary: New file has been added to the Index. It's unknown from the Head.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Staged
member.summary: New version of a file has been added to the Index. A previous version exists in the Head.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Removed
member.summary: The deletion of a file has been promoted from the working directory to the Index. A previous version exists in the Head.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Untracked
member.summary: New file in the working directory, unknown from the Index and the Head.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Modified
member.summary: The file has been updated in the working directory. A previous version exists in the Index.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.FileStatus.Missing
member.summary: The file has been deleted from the working directory. A previous version exists in the Index.

member.summary: Promotes to the staging area the latest modifications of a collection of files in the working directory (addition, updation or removal).
member.param: The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.Unstage(System.String)
member.summary: Removes from the staging area all the modifications of a file since the latest commit (addition, updation or removal).
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.Unstage(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Removes from the staging area all the modifications of a collection of file since the latest commit (addition, updation or removal).

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.Move(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Moves and/or renames a file in the working directory and promotes the change to the staging area.
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory which has to be moved/renamed.
The target path of the file within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.Move(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Moves and/or renames a collection of files in the working directory and promotes the changes to the staging area.
member.param: The paths of the files within the working directory which have to be moved/renamed.
The target paths of the files within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.Remove(System.String)
member.summary:
Removes a file from the working directory and promotes the removal to the staging area.
If the file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
member.param: The path of the file within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.Remove(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Removes a collection of files from the working directory and promotes the removal to the staging area.
If a file has already been deleted from the working directory, this method will only deal with promoting the removal to the staging area.
member.param: The collection of paths of the files within the working directory.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.RetrieveStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the state of a file in the working directory, comparing it against the staging area and the latest commmit.
member.param: The relative path within the working directory to the file.
member.returns: A representing the state of the parameter.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Index.RetrieveStatus
member.summary: Retrieves the state of all files in the working directory, comparing them against the staging area and the latest commmit.
member.returns: A holding the state of all the files.

member.name: M:LibGit2Sharp.Repository.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
For a standard repository, should either point to the ".git" folder or to the working directory. For a bare repository, should directly point to the repository folder.
member.param: The path to the git repository to open, can be either the path to the git directory (for non-bare repositories this would be the ".git" folder inside the working directory) or the path to the working directory.

true to initialize a bare repository. False otherwise, to initialize a standard ".git" repository.
member.returns: a new instance of the class. The client code is responsible for calling on this instance.

member.summary: List of files added to the index, which are already in the current commit with different content

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryStatus.Removed
member.summary: List of files removed from the index but are existent in the current commit

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryStatus.Missing
member.summary: List of files existent in the index but are missing in the working directory

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryStatus.Modified
member.summary: List of files with unstaged modifications. A file may be modified and staged at the same time if it has been modified after adding.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryStatus.Untracked
member.summary: List of files existing in the working directory but are neither tracked in the index nor in the current commit.

member.name: P:LibGit2Sharp.RepositoryStatus.IsDirty
member.summary: True if the index or the working directory has been altered since the last commit. False otherwise.

member.name: F:LibGit2Sharp.ResetOptions.Mixed
member.summary: Moves the branch pointed to by HEAD to the specified commit object and resets the index to the tree recorded by the commit.
